law.catch_line: A licensed dentist may not advertise:...

section.section:
A licensed dentist may not:
Use the designation "Dental Surgeon" on a sign that bears the name of the licensee; or
Include a specialty designation in a card, letterhead, sign, telephone directory listing, or other printed matter that bears the name of the licensee, unless:
The licensee is identified by the Board as a specialist in the designated field under § 4-504 of this subtitle; and
The language used to refer to the specialty is approved by the Board.
A licensed dentist may use the designations "Dr.", "dentist", "D.D.S.", or "D.M.D." on a sign that bears the licensee's name.

text.section: A person who is not a licensed dentist may not solicit or advertise to the general public in any manner that the person alters, constructs, duplicates, repairs, or supplies a dental appliance.
